Akasaka - I wanted to look closer at the surface before I tried to call 
a smith. I was originally thinking Tadashige like Pete but I tend to 
think of his work as a bit more granular. It's a big tsuba at 85mm, I 
think because of the size, the tall tapered seppa dai and the fine hitsu 
ana, I will try for the 2nd master Tadamasa.

Cheers

Rich Turner



Jim Gilbert wrote:
> http://ph.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/photos/browse/cb94
>
> 85.5 mm H x 83.5 mm W 
> 5.9 mm thick at the mimi 
> ~6.1mm thick at the seppa dai.
>
> The edges of the nakago ana are slightly beveled.
